word_mean: 系统，系：一组或一系列相互关连或相互依赖的部分或实体(物质，器官，或有机体)，在共同目的下合力发挥其功能，或产生的结果是其中单独一部分的活动或动作所不能达到的
学派，派：基于一整套特殊原理而建立的一种学派或实施方法，如医学中的折衷派或盖仑派
为实现规定功能以达到某一目标而构成的相互关联的一个集合体或装置(部件)。

sentence.Network_en: Megamalls and fast food restaurants line the highway system.

sentence.Network_en: The new system is still in the planning stages.
sentence.Network_cn: 新体系仍处于规划阶段。

sentence.Network_en: There is nothing sinister or conspiratorial about the export licensing system.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种出口许可制度没有任何阴险或者见不得人的东西。

phrase.cizu_name: get something out of one's system

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)get rid of a preoccupation or anxiety

lj.lj_ly: yelling is an ace way of getting stress out of your system.
lj.lj_ls: 大声叫喊是消除压力的一种有效方法。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French système or late Latin systema, from Greek sustēma, from sun- 'with' + histanai 'set up'

encyclopedia.content: system.exe是netcontroller木马病毒生成的文件，出现在c:\windows目录下，建议将其删除。但要与系统的system进程区分开来。system进程是没有。exe的。

entry.def: A system is a way of working, organizing, or doing something which follows a fixed plan or set of rules. You can use system to refer to an organization or institution that is organized in this way.

example.ex: The present system of funding for higher education is unsatisfactory.
example.tran: 目前高等教育的经费体制并不令人满意。

example.ex: ...a flexible and relatively efficient filing system.
example.tran: 灵活而相对高效的存档系统

entry.def: A system is a set of devices powered by electricity, for example a computer or an alarm.

example.ex: Viruses tend to be good at surviving when a computer system crashes.
example.tran: 计算机病毒在系统崩溃后往往依然存在。

entry.def: A system is a set of equipment or parts such as water pipes or electrical wiring, which is used to supply water, heat, or electricity.
A system is a network of things that are linked together so that people or things can travel from one place to another or communicate.

example.tran: 澳大利亚的公路网和铁路网

example.ex: ...a news channel on a local cable system.
example.tran: 地方有线电视网的新闻频道

entry.def: Your system is your body's  organs and other parts that together perform particular functions.

example.ex: He had slept for over fourteen hours, and his system seemed to have recuperated admirably...
example.tran: 他已睡了超过 14 个小时了，他的身体恢复得很不错。

example.ex: These gases would seriously damage the patient's respiratory system.
example.tran: 这些毒气会严重损害患者的呼吸系统。

entry.tran: (尤指数学或科学中的)体系,体制
entry.def: A system is a particular set of rules, especially in mathematics or science, which is used to count or measure things.

example.ex: ...the decimal system of metric weights and measures.

example.tran: 特拉赫滕贝格简化的数学体系

entry.tran: 政府;现行体制;公共行政
entry.def: People sometimes refer to the government or administration of a country as the system .

example.ex: These feelings are likely to make people attempt to overthrow the system...
example.tran: 这些情绪有可能促使人们想要推翻现行的体制。

example.ex: He wants to be the tough rebel who bucks the system.
example.tran: 他想成为现行体制的坚决反抗者。

entry.tran: 宣泄;排解;戒掉;让…淡出自己的生活
entry.def: If you get something out of your system, you take some action so that you no longer want to do it or no longer have strong feelings about it.

example.ex: I want to get boxing out of my system and settle down to enjoy family life.
example.tran: 我想结束拳击生涯，安定下来享受家庭生活。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole;

sentences.sentence: "a vast system of production and distribution and consumption keep the country going"

means.word_mean: 2. instrumentality that combines interrelated interacting artifacts designed to work as a coherent entity;

sentences.sentence: "the system consists of a motor and a small computer"

means.word_mean: 3. a complex of methods or rules governing behavior;

sentences.sentence: "they have to operate under a system they oppose"
"that language has a complex system for indicating gender"

means.word_mean: 4. a procedure or process for obtaining an objective;

sentences.sentence: "they had to devise a system that did not depend on cooperation"

means.word_mean: 5. a group of physiologically or anatomically related organs or parts;

sentences.sentence: "the body has a system of organs for digestion"

means.word_mean: 6. an organized structure for arranging or classifying;

sentences.sentence: "he changed the arrangement of the topics"
"the facts were familiar but it was in the organization of them that he was original"
"he tried to understand their system of classification"

means.word_mean: 7. (physical chemistry) a sample of matter in which substances in different phases are in equilibrium;

sentences.sentence: "in a static system oil cannot be replaced by water on a surface"

means.word_mean: 8. the living body considered as made up of interdependent components forming a unified whole;

sentences.sentence: "exercise helped him get the alcohol out of his system"

means.word_mean: 9. an ordered manner; orderliness by virtue of being methodical and well organized;

sentences.sentence: "his compulsive organization was not an endearing quality"
"we can't do it unless we establish some system around here"

auth_sentence.res_content: They could gradually move others to a new system.

Sentence.sentence: The latest congressional report acknowledges the critical importance of technical training, but also asserts that the study of the humanities (人文学科)and social sciences must remain central components of America's educational system at all levels.
Third, decide on your own system for marking.
Choose one's own system of marking

sentences.en: He created a new system of teaching foreign languages.
sentences.cn: 他创造了一种新的外语教学体系。

sentences.en: The new system has had a disastrous effect on productivity.
sentences.cn: 新制度对生产率产生了灾难性的影响。

sentences.en: Too much alcohol is bad for the system.

jushi.english: You mustn't expect good results if you work without system.
jushi.chinese: 如果你们工作没有条理,就不会得到好的效果。

jushi.english: Too much alcohol is bad for the system.
The solar system consists of the sun and its planets.
jushi.chinese: 太阳系由太阳及其行星构成。
